programme.desc: Musical drama set to the songs of The Proclaimers. Two ex-soldiers (George MacKay and Kevin Guthrie) think they've found their perfect women, but a secret threatens their happiness.
programme.title: Sunshine on Leith

programme.desc: Animation. When a power-crazy billionaire hatches a plan to claim the moon as his own property, a boy, a girl and a grumpy ex-astronaut grandad embark on a mission to stop him.
programme.title: Capture the Flag

programme.desc: Family fantasy starring Hal Scardino and Litefoot. A boy is given a magical cupboard as a gift on his ninth birthday - and discovers it can bring his toys to life. With Steve Coogan.
programme.title: The Indian in the Cupboard

programme.desc: Comedy with John Lithgow and Melinda Dillon. A family adopt a Bigfoot after their car hits a large hairy animal. The creature is unhurt but will soon needs their protection.
programme.title: Harry and the Hendersons
X-Men: The Last Stand
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure. The X-Men face a new threat: the development of an enforced cure for mutants. Starring Famke Janssen, Halle Berry, Ian McKellen and Patrick Stewart. Violence.

programme.title: Atomic Blonde
programme.desc: Violent thriller starring Charlize Theron. A British spy is sent to Cold War Berlin to retrieve a very sensitive list. With Sofia Boutella and James McAvoy. Very Strong language/sex.

programme.title: A Million Ways to Die in the West
programme.desc: In Seth 'Family Guy' MacFarlane's take on the Western, a sheep farmer finds himself love rival to a moustache and a notorious murderer. Strong, crude language/sex/violence/drugs.

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: Thriller about a woman whose family was slaughtered by her brother. Starring Charlize Theron and Nicholas Hoult. Adult themes/very strong language/violence/drugs.
